intro: Dysoxylum balansanum, commonly known as the Balansanum tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, elongated fruits that resemble tamarinds. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and traditional medicine.
